channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024030216
item.description:
Report E-2024030216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, one (1) 40-pound bag of calcium peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to sweep up the released product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. HES personnel removed the damaged bag from the shipment and placed it into the same drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was dropped while being unloaded from the trailer causing 1 of the glass jugs to break. I was called to contain and clean the spill. Sand was put down to contain the spill and the package was put into a salvage drum and taken to the hazmat processing area. the sand was cleaned up and disposed of properly DescribePack: The glass jug shattered spilled all content DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was surround the box and and top of the fluid, it was swept and disposed of

item.title: Report E-2024030223
item.description:
Report E-2024030223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 quart of drain clean (UN1830) was released from a bottle due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller and it was determined that the terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on-site and the SCMs approval. (1) 5 gallon DF contains empty plastic bottle with oil dry was containerized and created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030162
item.description:
Report E-2024030162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 28, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon pail of Zepa Lume was damaged by a skid and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that R+L personnel had cleaned the impacted areas. HES personnel containerized the singular damaged carton into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.
